results.title: Leisure lines
results.creator_credit: Terry Jennings, South Australian Film Corporation and New Films
results.brief_description: Leisure and recreation are becoming increasingly important to people in the community. Its important that there be some physical side to it and also enjoyment and relaxation. In addition, as this film points out, good facilities and community organisations are required to help people make the most of their leisuretime. Produced for the South Australian Department of Tourism, Recreation and Sport.

results.title: Kangaroo Island
results.creator_credit: Ron Lowe and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: The Australian wildlife seen by visitors to Kangaroo Island, South Australia, is the subject of this award-winning film. Koalas, kangaroos, emus, pelicans and seals abound on this island sanctuary, completely unafraid of humans. Their daily activities form a fascinating study. Contains no commentary, only sounds of nature and background music composed by Bruce Smeaton. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: The Inhabited man
results.creator_credit: Peter Dimond, South Australian Film Corporation and John Dick
results.brief_description: A talking flea makes a young man aware that he has scabies though he could have countless other organisms living on his body. Anxious, the young man visits a doctor who explains to him that whilst complete prevention is not yet possible, sound personal hygiene can cut down on the incidence of scabies.

results.title: Ian Chappell on cricket
results.creator_credit: Terry Jennings, South Australian Film Corporation and Vincent O'Donnell
results.brief_description: Australian Captain, Ian Chappell, and three other Test cricket players, Ashley Mallett, Terry Jenner and Eric Freeman, demonstrate the elements of the game. Using freeze-frame and slow motion techniques, the subtlety of various batting strokes and bowling deliveries are revealed by the experts, from the way a wrist is turned to the intricate foot-work required.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Terry Jennings, South Australian Film Corporation and Vincent O’Donnell

results.title: Good news day
results.creator_credit: South Australian Film Corporation and Phillip Mark-Law
results.brief_description: This film makes a statement about the attractiveness and cultural diversity of the Australian way of life by comparing scenes from Adelaide with the screaming headlines of newspapers and radio.

results.title: Border country
results.creator_credit: Peter Thompson, Jill Robb, South Australian Film Corporation and Trojan Films
results.brief_description: A cinematic exploration of South Eastern South Australia, a region that combines the wild beauty of The Coorong with lush grazing properties, pine forests, Mt Gambier’s famous Blue Lake, and the quiet charm of small fishing villages.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Thompson, Jill Robb, South Australian Film Corporation and Trojan Films

results.title: The Barossa
results.creator_credit: David Lourie, South Australian Film Corporation and Albert Falzon Productions
results.brief_description: Unsurpassed scenery, friendly people, vintage festivals, a pleasant sip of wine and unrivalled cuisine - all are part of the Barossa. This film shows the places, people and traditional events which make the Barossa Valley one of Australia’s most exciting wine districts.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Lourie, South Australian Film Corporation and Albert Falzon Productions

results.title: Jewellery making: acrylics
results.creator_credit: South Australian Film Corporation and Terry Jennings
results.brief_description: Deals with the use of both solid and liquid acrylic in the production of modern jewellery. One of Australia’s leading jewellers. Rex Keogh, shows the way his own pieces use these simple processes.
results.creator_credit_for_label: South Australian Film Corporation and Terry Jennings

results.title: Great coastal dune show
results.creator_credit: Andrew Prowse, Ron Saunders, Malcolm Smith and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Sponsored by the Department of Environment, Housing and Community Developments, this film adopts a satirical approach to the needs of a coastal dwelling nation like Australia actively trying to preserve coastline ecosystems. The film is short and its “message” is sharp: building on sand is insecure in more than one sense. Largely because of the humorous approach taken by the scriptwriter, the future impact of interference with dune communities should be felt by all audiences but, in particular, those who see the film in the classroom.

results.title: Guns and poses (remix)
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description: This single-channel tape is a remix of the video component of the installation NT YT FREE STYLES. X-PRZ constructs a powerful collage of rap music, authorial text, and iconic visuals to confront the politics of race in the context of the American media. Cokes writes,`Slick and easily legible Pop surface: deploying the Black male media projection as central model, heroic figure, and exploited buffoon of fear-mongers in the media. Moving images: clips from Gangsta rap videos, LA Rebellion 1992, the ‘Jam’ Michael Jackson/Michael Jordon video and other film sources.Sound: Adapted from the ‘Murder was the Case’ soundtrack with works by Dr. Dre, Ice Cube, and Snoop Doggy Dog.’
